channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Tribe that gave Kansas its name has reclaimed a big piece of its sacred heritage
item.description: The Kaw tribe has reclaimed a sacred boulder that was used for a century as a monument to some of the people who pushed them out of Kansas.
item.content:encoded: The Kaw tribe has reclaimed a sacred boulder that was used for a century as a monument to some of the people who pushed them out of Kansas.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris

item.title: Rep. Bowman is the first of the progressives known as 'the squad' to be defeated
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to strategist Kristen Hawn about Democrat George Latimer winning the most expensive House primary campaign in history. He had significant support from pro-Israel lobbyists.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to strategist Kristen Hawn about Democrat George Latimer winning the most expensive House primary campaign in history. He had significant support from pro-Israel lobbyists.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Opinion on important abortion case appeared briefly on the Supreme Courtâ€™s website
item.description: Reporters at Bloomberg Law read that opinion before it was removed. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Kimberly Robinson, a Supreme Court reporter with Bloomberg Law.
item.content:encoded: Reporters at Bloomberg Law read that opinion before it was removed. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to Kimberly Robinson, a Supreme Court reporter with Bloomberg Law.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Top tips from Life Kit: 7 ideas to make your summer safer and brighter
item.description: A roundup of useful advice from our June episodes: how to reach a "eureka moment" at work, the safest place to put a grill (not against the house!), and a counterintuitive way to get over your crush.
item.content:encoded:
A roundup of useful advice from our June episodes: how to reach a "eureka moment" at work, the safest place to put a grill (not against the house!), and a counterintuitive way to get over your crush.

(Image credit: Becky Harlan)
item.dc:creator: Life Kit

item.title: Israel's many conflicts could soon crack its Iron Dome
item.description: The Iron Dome system has protected Israelis for more than a decade, but it can't stop everything. A war in Lebanon could push it past its limits.
item.content:encoded:
The Iron Dome system has protected Israelis for more than a decade, but it can't stop everything. A war in Lebanon could push it past its limits.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Tribes honor the birth of rare white buffalo and reveal its name: Wakan Gli
item.description: The moment marked the highlight of a Native American ceremony to commemorate the calf's birth that featured the retelling of how a mysterious woman brought a message of reassurance during hard times.
item.content:encoded:
The moment marked the highlight of a Native American ceremony to commemorate the calf's birth that featured the retelling of how a mysterious woman brought a message of reassurance during hard times.

(Image credit: Jordan Creech via AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At the factory that builds the 737 Max, Boeing rethinks how it trains new hires
item.description: Troubled plane maker Boeing is changing how it trains new recruits at the factory near Seattle where it assembles the 737 Max, part of a broader effort to improve quality after a midair blowout.
item.content:encoded:
Troubled plane maker Boeing is changing how it trains new recruits at the factory near Seattle where it assembles the 737 Max, part of a broader effort to improve quality after a midair blowout.

(Image credit: Jennifer Buchanan)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Beethoven was a classical and romantic composer, but his body was full of heavy metal
item.description: Virtuosic pianist and composer Beethoven suffered from several debilitating ailments. A new study suggests lead poisoning may be at least partly to blame.
item.content:encoded:
Virtuosic pianist and composer Beethoven suffered from several debilitating ailments. A new study suggests lead poisoning may be at least partly to blame.

(Image credit: The Print Collector)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Voter prep for Biden-Trump debate: Where they stand on foreign policy, abortion
item.description: With the presidential candidates debate nearing, we present the final installment of our voter's debate prep series. Today we cover foreign policy and abortion.
item.content:encoded: With the presidential candidates debate nearing, we present the final installment of our voter's debate prep series. Today we cover foreign policy and abortion.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Over a 3-hour period in Bolivia, a coup attempt is launched and then quickly quelled
item.description: A top military general in Bolivia on Wednesday attempted to overthrow the government. The failed coup was put down quickly and the general was arrested.
item.content:encoded: A top military general in Bolivia on Wednesday attempted to overthrow the government. The failed coup was put down quickly and the general was arrested.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
